document.title: Pennsylvania Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content

A6EED4595FD04E6384CD1C5827D87713.description: Provide a concluding section that follows from and supports the analysis presented.

04D6D654303A4E53BFC4CC10D7A23C9E.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

03470A0B279D48F2B3C3A660577ABED1.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic and/or convey the experience and events.

C72B1D082D014FCB9A07B6E95C9BA92C.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

31ED0F3A7FD0408B8167B3E0310E7CE8.description: Develop the analysis using relevant evidence from text(s) to support claims, opinions, ideas, and inferences and demonstrating an understanding of the text(s).

13161285EBE7475FADF91427542C6125.description: Introduce text(s) for the intended audience, state an opinion and/or topic, establish a situation, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

22F4B6B476154E25A4B9C5F7065F93E5.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and/or research.

82880DC757614D39BAE4C972616B1512.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.*

362A6684B9E449E491466C32E986F72E.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.*

9919340DBB964A00800C5E6E53DCC1A8.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.*

EC42ADC6AC9049778C41377F539C5B7B.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.*

79B092452D564D5AB1142BFE93C808C1.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions.

E905C776BF1F40F6AB43C19B1F7B48C5.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.*

60E69E828F324CF5BCDE8E44F2337E69.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, and dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.*

CDC156E75EF74A7B937966428CB3905B.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

FB252CD2E4EA4FAAAB16038F11AF893C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling.

CA24EDC8040F47D396AFE0F12D51724D.description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their, they’re).*

1737D1D7F5C84066B41D43560F68F7C3.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-on sentences.*

C421CF14D47649E48033D839B6032147.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.*

C642907D5A6B4B62906C9912E4DA4D8B.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).*

83E59509DF0D46D79AA97FAD6BF28D66.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.*

D6161700F68F4C16B2BC860DF31283A4.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.*

6FEE150F457947B5B233B3C94BF9F80D.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

33492605ADEB4344A5C36A07ED5EFAC9.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

72FE673E8700400C88AF9126631D824B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage.

17EC8A400FC845B5889EC351FECCEF80.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

321CBD20F75743FB96EAF618ED524A21.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

ECB13A9E52C54BE2AE30C6618298B2EE.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and to signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

52463B3D2B8642F8A19545D7E4191740.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

4A03480A097D4BBEBD1F73E4555E8F7B.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically to support the writer’s purpose.

556DA5DFBC9442A4AA92F06BAD174244.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

40B18BC3399748C186F1942E6A7F6007.description:
Provide a concluding section that follows from and
supports the information or explanation presented.

98B3811891704DA1BE89AEA93348F503.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

CB6A76210145427C913476FB76A4FD04.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

B78EEA23C4574B97B9DCBABCB8F71F37.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

379E939E905A48AB98D15C7092401AC9.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

0772382386514AF4AECEB485ACFAC016.description: Introduce a topic for the intended audience and preview what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information using strategies such as definition, classification, compare/contrast, and cause/effect to support the writer’s purpose.

C0B0A00604664430B228129704F973E6.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

E3D2A6D856B849C2B11F272F4E430476.description:
Provide a concluding section that reinforces the
claims and reasons presented.

57BD749EB78C45B685E394CA160E33EA.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

F0CCB3E15C104A549807B199677A6D81.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

A91D2069090A4CDDB6D6DF6AAE636460.description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

67DD3A3124DE4ECF8BEFFB89F40544CD.description: Introduce claim(s) for the intended audience, acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and support the writer’s purpose by logically organizing the reasons and evidence.

3B2BB6DD7DF34A208D627C69DD66C736.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

9BBBA11035E844CDA49A27BD85FBEB60.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary and mythological allusions) in context. b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words. c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

F0B90DAE914140BD81A0395D59DCBD0E.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph, a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
b. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).
c. Determine the meaning of technical words and phrases used in a text.

15D515289C5E4219A4B6449529674C52.description: Demonstrate understanding of vocabulary and figurative language in informational texts.

BD23C56EC2A54CAE95F617B2141E7BB4.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

C03BF46C661747BABAEE0CCFA1520D0E.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

2031F2BBFF4842399ED24420039B544D.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within, between, and/or among informational texts.

E6BD75BD8903471A94F97CF9D121293A.description: Determine how the author uses the meaning of words or phrases, including figurative, connotative, or technical meanings, in a text; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

F93EACF040BB447495D3751EB4B113D3.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how major sections and text features contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

53F9678161C5470E9EE915AC103F21A3.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

4E273991C8C6420FA91E8A399D3640D9.description: Demonstrate understanding of craft and structure in informational texts.

602923600003462D964849B5FD30896C.description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, how individuals influence ideas or events).

76B54A640E0B47938E88EBA1FB163C0C.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

2C0431765F8A42D2B0265F45B324EE0E.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences, conclusions, and/or generalizations drawn from the text.

936D814368C7475FA241A6F18A1B108A.description: Demonstrate understanding of key ideas and details in informational texts.

ECB1CB8EF2924D848BB6374608007FE5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary and mythological allusions) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

B795FDE3EF554178A987E1A060E06922.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
b. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

0272459B71EF41E98471894266F22EE6.description: Demonstrate understanding of vocabulary and figurative language in literature.

82F78BACF9714E70B5A652154F50365D.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

B7AE98704ADD4612B8B610249FC3E307.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within, between, and/or among texts.

119C6BF3923047E1B8C6E708FEA8D0EB.description: Determine how the author uses the meaning of words or phrases, including figurative and connotative meanings, in a text; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

C2C3B5DBB005415BB5973E08EBAF1A5A.description: Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

0086C87B755A4A0D9AEEBE8E70F1DF10.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

410D1889DE894C86968A1BA58BFF51B9.description: Demonstrate understanding of craft and structure in literature.

263461AD22BB4C7A8DC1332E44D2CBC5.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story, drama, or poem interact (e.g., how the setting shapes the characters or plot).

3FAE466A6DD648CE829C3B74C31DB600.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

4167C8DE062B415788A345F03F0AC5D8.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences, conclusions, and/or generalizations drawn from the text.

0DDA34661564412A95275ED42E68F6E3.description: Demonstrate understanding of key ideas and details in literature.
